original_solution_mapping.L1: He wants to eat 80*2=<<80*2=160>>160 grams of protein a day
original_solution_mapping.L2: That means he needs 160/.8=<<160/.8=200>>200 grams of protein per day
original_solution_mapping.L3: So he needs 200*7=<<200*7=1400>>1400 grams per week

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5435.
    Returns: the amount of protein powder Matt needs to eat per week.
    """
    # L1
    body_weight_kg = 80 # weighs 80 kg
    protein_per_kg = 2 # 2 grams of protein per kilogram of body weight
    daily_protein_needed = body_weight_kg * protein_per_kg

    # L2
    protein_powder_protein_percentage = 0.8 # 80% protein
    daily_protein_powder_needed = daily_protein_needed / protein_powder_protein_percentage

    # L3
    days_per_week = 7 # WK
    weekly_protein_powder_needed = daily_protein_powder_needed * days_per_week

    # FA
    answer = weekly_protein_powder_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He wants to eat {body_weight_kg}*{protein_per_kg}=<<{body_weight_kg}*{protein_per_kg}={daily_protein_needed}>>{daily_protein_needed} grams of protein a day

That means he needs {daily_protein_needed}/{protein_powder_protein_percentage}=<<{daily_protein_needed}/{protein_powder_protein_percentage}={daily_protein_powder_needed}>>{daily_protein_powder_needed} grams of protein per day
So he needs {daily_protein_powder_needed}*{days_per_week}=<<{daily_protein_powder_needed}*{days_per_week}={weekly_protein_powder_needed}>>{weekly_protein_powder_needed} grams per week
